page.title: 05CHURCH SERVICES
page.content: At Pyecombe they have 2 services a month, Evensong on the second Sunday of the month and Holy Communion on the fourth Sunday of each month. The attendance usually averages 2O-25 people which has grown from about 6 or 7 over the last 6 years. Mostly older people come to the services as only half a dozen school children come. The attendance is about 1O% of the population of Pyecombe. The music at the Church is provided by an organ at the back end of the church; the organist has just completed 25 years of playing. The books used in the service are the English Hymnal and the Prayer Book for Evensong, and for Communion the Alternative Services Book. The main types of people that go to the Church tend to be farmers, school teachers and business commuters.
